channel.title: Star Wars: Darth Vader (2015) on jverkamp.com
channel.description: Recent content in Star Wars: Darth Vader (2015) on jverkamp.com

item.title: Darth Vader, Vol. 4: End of Games
item.description:
Okay. We’re heading towards the conclusion of this particular story arc. I really do like this length. 4 volumes has about as much oomph as a novel length story, albeit with a much higher concentration of pretty* pictures.

With that being said, Vader is making his way back into Palpatine’s good (bad?) graces–but he now truly understands how the Sith work.

item.title: Darth Vader, Vol. 3: The Shu-Torun War
item.description: Okay, now this went a bit sideways. Forget the Emperor and politicking (more or less). Instead, get thrown into a rivalry on a mining planet that’s obsessed with etiquette…

item.title: Darth Vader, Vol. 2: Shadows and Secrets
Darth Vader, Vol. 1: Vader
item.description:
Star Wars!

I’m of an age where I didn’t catch the original trilogy in theaters, instead watching it over and over again on VHS. When the prequels came out, I absolutely went to see them over and over in theaters (they’re not great, but they’re not as bad as they’ve been made out to be). Now more recently the new trilogy–well, I suppose I should finish those.
